  • Documentation generation
  • dpnd_Export_HTML

command dpnd_Export_HTML

Generates the HTML documentation from the extracted array p_ExtractArray.

command dpnd_Export_HTML p_NativeDocArray, p_Folder, p_TemplatePath, [p_CProp], [p_CustomPages], [p_iFrame], [p_CallBack], [p_MenuHideHandlers]
Parameters
TypeNameDescription
p_NativeDocArray Array that contains the documentation to generate. See dpnd_ExtractStack for more informations.
p_Folder Folder path where to generate the documentation.
p_TemplatePath Folder path where the NativeDoc HTML Template is located.
[p_CProp] Array containing custom properties.
[p_CustomPages] Array containing user defined HTML pages.
[p_iFrame] Set to true to generate a website using iFrame. (WARNING: Use alongside a Frame template!)
[p_CallBack] The long id of the object to call back. (To display the progress)
[p_MenuHideHandlers] Set to true to not display handlers inside the menu tree.
Description

To customize the generated documentation, for example to add multiples stacks into one documentation simply customize the array p_ExtractArray.
Example: You want to have the documentation of the stack "myLibrary" and the other stack "myOtherLibrary",
this is really easy:

put dpnd_ExtractStack("myLibrary") into t_NativeDoc
put dpnd_ExtractStack("myOtherLibrary") into t_Temp
union t_NativeDoc with t_Temp
dpnd_Export_GenHTML t_NativeDoc, "C:/Temp/Documentation"...

- To display documentation under a special node:
External libraries are located under the ["external"] node.
Libraries are located under the ["library"] node.

Properties:
To generate a correct documentation, the p_NativeDocArray array must contains those fields set:
- p_NativeDocArray["project"] -> eg. DPConfig
- p_NativeDocArray["company"] -> eg. NativeSoft
- p_NativeDocArray["copyright"] -> eg. (c) 2008-2010 NativeSoft. All rights reserved worldwide.
- p_NativeDocArray["author"] -> eg. Damien Girard

Custom properties:
Since NativeDoc 3.0, it is possible to set custom properties inside the tree.
Thoses properties will be replaced inside the templates.
eg. Replace the text $PROJECT_CODE with "ID 2000" inside the templates files.

Format of the array:
- p_CProp[<id>]["variable"] -- Text to replace inside the template.
- p_CProp[<id>]["value"] -- Value to set.

Custom pages:
NativeDoc 3.0 can add user defined pages inside the documentation.
In prior version, it was possible to have only three custom pages (p_MainPage, p_Readme, p_About)

Now you can create as many page as you want.

Format of the array:
- p_CustomPages[<id or "main">] -- Array defining a custom page. Set to "main" to set the mainpage content.
- p_CustomPages[<id>]["title"] -- Title of the page. (eg. "About" or "Readme")
- p_CustomPages[<id>]["html"] -- HTML content of the page.

Callback:
The callback command called is the following:
on dpnd_Export_HTML_Callback p_PercentProgress

p_PercentProgress is the progress in percent. (0-100)

A little wait time with message is done in order to let the UI to be redrawn.

iFrame website:
If you set p_iFrame to true, then the website generated will be using an iFrame for the content.
The menu will be stored inside the main index.htm file, and all other files will not include the menu.

An iFrame template must have the file Template_iFrame.htm in the root folder ! This file will be used to generate MainPage/About Page etc...

Note: you must use a frame template. Otherwise, unexpected results can occurs.

Return

The list of all errors met by the engine.

Warning

If there is any files that already exists in the folder, they will be overwritten!

Errors
Error CodeDescription
"array" p_NativeDocArray is not an array.
"write" The files cannot be written.
"template" The template cannot be found or is corrupted.
Version

3.0 The handler has been updated in version 3.0, you must update your applications.

See also

dpnd_ExtractStack
